uk.ac.leeds.ccg.raster
Class Raster

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleGeoData
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.raster.Raster
All Implemented Interfaces:
GeoData, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
circleRaster
public class Raster
extends SimpleGeoData
implements java.io.Serializable

It is common to want to distinguish between a missing value (nodata) and a value that is zero or another value that does not effect the result of a calulation (e.g. The value 0.0d in addition and subtraction, and the value 1.0d as an exponent power or as a value in a multiplication or the denominator in a division). A default value can be defined as the value which every cell has if it is not in an (id,list) hashtable containing the other values. In version 1.9 of Raster the default value was always 0.0d. This was changed to be nodata in version 1.10 and get and set methods for this value were provided. There are advantages in terms of memory usage to using a hashtable if more than half the values are the default value (because of the need to store the id otherwise in the hashtable). There are various options for Raster storage that should be considered for geoTools2. The nature of the values in a Raster and its size determine what what storage is best in terms of memory usage and speed of getting and setting values.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getMissingValueCode

public double getMissingValueCode()
Description copied from class: SimpleGeoData
Not all posible ids will have a value stored in the GeoData object, so when a call is made to getValue with an id that is not stored a special value is returned to signify that a value for this id is missing.
A call to this method will return the current code in use to represent that situation.
Overrides:
getMissingValueCode in class SimpleGeoData
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleGeoData
Returns:
double The current value representing missing data.
See Also:
SimpleGeoData.setMissingValueCode(double)

setMissingValueCode

public void setMissingValueCode(double mv)
Description copied from class: SimpleGeoData
Not all posible ids will have a value stored in the GeoData object, so when a call is made to getValue with an id that is not stored a special value is returned to signify that a value for this id is missing.
By default that value is set to MISSING, however this behavoir can be changed by calling this method with a new value.
Overrides:
setMissingValueCode in class SimpleGeoData
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleGeoData
Parameters:
mv - A double containing the new value to represent missing data.
See Also:
SimpleGeoData.getMissingValueCode()

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Description copied from class: SimpleGeoData
All GeoData objects can have a name associated with them.
Typicaly the name will match the Column heading from which the data came from.
Names can be important when the GeoData is used in thematic maps as this is the name that will be placed in the key by default.
Overrides:
getName in class SimpleGeoData
Returns:
the name of the raster
